title: List of heads of state of Greece - Wikipedia
snippet: The Second Hellenic Republic was a parliamentary republic which was proclaimed on 25 March 1924 and a referendum was held to abolish the Monarchy. The Second Republic was abolished after the 1935 monarchy referendum. The President of the Republic had a symbolic role as head of the state.

title: Ioannis Kapodistrias, Modern Greece’s first head of state - Greek News Agenda
snippet: Ioannis Kapodistrias was the first head of state of Greece. Arguably the most illustrious Greek of his time, he became Governor of the newly-founded independent Greek state after a notable career in international diplomacy.

title: President - Aρχική
snippet: PRESIDENT of the Hellenic Republic The President Constantine An. Tassoulas Personal Info Place and Date οf Birth: He was born in Ioannina in 1959. Marital Status: He is married with lawyer Fani Stathopoulou and has two children Tasos and Magda. Profession: A member of the Athens Bar Association.

title: President of Greece - Wikipedia
snippet: The current Third Hellenic Republic (Greek: Γʹ Ελληνική Δημοκρατία) was established in 1974 during the period of metapolitefsi, after the end of the Greek junta which had controlled Greece since the coup d'état of 21 April 1967.

title: Katerina Sakellaropoulou - Wikipedia
snippet: She was elected by the Hellenic Parliament to succeed Prokopis Pavlopoulos on 22 January 2020. Prior to her election as president, Sakellaropoulou served as president of the Council of State, the highest administrative court of Greece.
